definition: noisy talk, to speak about unimportant matters rapidly and incessantly
details:
noun
- noisy talk
= synonyms: yak
- the high-pitched continuing noise made by animals like birds or monkeys
= example: the high-pitched continuing noise made by animals like birds or monkeys
= synonyms: chattering
- the rapid series of noises made by the parts of a machine
= synonyms: chattering
verb
- to speak about unimportant matters rapidly and incessantly
= synonyms: clack
- to make noise as if chattering away
= example: to make noise as if chattering away
- to talk socially without exchanging too much information
= synonyms: visit
- to cut unevenly with a chattering tool
- to click repeatedly or uncontrollably
= synonyms: click
